content_chunks.content:
Activities such as community creation and management, and networking pages to be placed on social media (i.e. Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter).

Note: Placing banners or text ads on social media is not included in this activity; they must be submitted as banner or text ads.
[[default_branding_requirements]]
[[not_allowed]]

Production: agency costs for page design, development, maintenance, and upload.

3. Agency/Agent management fees
4. Total invoice amount
5. Creative Costs and Production Costs (including Web maintenance and Web set up costs)
6. Media costs when applicable (include unit and unit cost)
7. Social media (URL) name
Submit as ONLINE - Social Media.

Email marketing is a form of direct marketing which uses electronic mail as a means of communicating to an audience. Only opt-in email advertising, whereby the recipient of the advertisement has consented to receive it, is supported. Common examples are E-newsletter and direct e-mail.
[[default_online_branding_requirements]]

Not allowed in the activity.
[[competitive_allowed_online]]

Net media cost: actual costs to place an advertisement in the intended media vehicle.
Both pay per delivered and/or pay per opened models are supported.
Production and Creative Costs

2. Tax, discounts, rebates, bonus ads
3. Agency/Agent management fees
4. Total invoice amount
5. eDM distribution cost (include unit: ex. cost per delivered; cost per opened and unit cost)
6. Quantity
No

According to the buying methodology, submit as follows:
email read submit as ONLINE - email cost per read
email delivered submit as ONLINE - email cost per delivered

A form of targeted advertising in which the ad is embedded in the Web page content (typically in the form of underlined keywords). It can be reimbursed on a Cost-per-click (CPC) basis. Ads may be displayed on the Web page or as a pop-up ad.

A type of mobile marketing that uses text or graphic messages as a medium of direct advertising. Both push and pull delivery methods are supported. The push delivery method is when the advertiser sends an ad to an end user who previously granted the advertiser permission to do so. The pull delivery method is when an end user sends a message to a number published on an ad and is sent a direct ad in return.
[[online_branding_requirements_no_member_product]]

Not allowed in the activity.
[[competitive_allowed_online]]
Net media cost
Production and Creative Costs
Content of the message and design of the landing page

1. Date/date range
2. Tax, discounts, rebates, bonus ads
3. Agency/Agent management fees
4. Total invoice amount
5. Web site (URL) name
6. Media Cost: include unit and unit cost (i.e. Messages sent or messages received)
No
Submit as ONLINE SMS/MMS.

Large scale events where the Member sells sponsorship packages to multiple companies. We will reimburse the Member up to 100% of the cost of a sponsorship package.
Sponsorship of Member Owned Events

To support Member events where the Member sells sponsorship packages to multiple companies, Intel offers a 100% reimbursement model for the cost of a sponsorship package. To be eligible for this reimbursement model, an event must have the following characteristics:

  • For a consumer event, greater than 1,000 people must be invited
  • For a business event, greater than 150 people must be invited
  • At least 4 companies (including Intel) must sponsor the event
  • Availability of an official sponsorship package and overall sponsorship structure

Intel pre-approval is required for these events.

Pre-Approval process steps:

  1. Customer pre-submits the event on the Create Activity page at least three weeks prior to the event
  2. When the activity is created, the Member will be provided with an Intel e-mail address for the submission of:
    • the official sponsorship package and overall sponsorship structure
    • indication of the sponsorship package discussed with your Intel contact, and name of contact
  3. Intel finance team will review documentation within five business days and may contact the Member if further information is needed.
  4. Customer will receive a notification once the event is approved.
As defined by the sponsorship package agreement.
Yes, at the Event but not in the Sponsorship package deliverables of the package bought by Intel.
As defined by sponsorship package agreement.
As defined by sponsorship package agreement.

1. Date/date range and location
2. Details defined by pre-approved sponsorship package agreement.
Yes, if sales are happening on site at the event.
Submit as EVENTS - Sponsorship. If subject to spending limits, submit as EVENTS - Sponsorship Limited Spend.

Event such as workshop and seminar organized by a Member. Invitation is available to any interested audience (online registrations, flyers on street, ads on newspaper, etc.) Pre-approval required if government attendees are invited.

Balanced branding in the activity:
  • Intel logo on all venue decor (signage, including fact tags) and at least one Intel logo on the booth/kiosk if applicable
  • Intel Mention when Member product or solution is mentioned in the presentation or demonstration (i.e. keynote, training, break out sessions etc). This requirement can also be met if there is an Intel keynote or Intel-led breakout session at the event
Additionally Intel will reimburse the following items when co-branded:
  • Giveaways
  • Uniform for staff
  • Handouts
  • Invitations
  • Registration Web site
Important: As per the general program requirement, Intel based systems must carry Intel Product Branding even if using a demo unit dedicated to the event or if the system is not yet commercially available.

Allowed. If included, will cut the net reimbursable cost of the activity in half before the appropriate reimbursement percentage rate is applied. Equal or greater prominence required for products based on Intel eligible processors and for Intel logos.

• Cost of hiring promoters
  • Promoters training cost (including venue)
  • Participation fee paid by Member or third party for a third party's participation/speaker
  • Creative design for event signage and booth or kiosk
  • Logistics and venue related costs ( i.e. booth/venue set up; decoration; carpet, electrical, internet, furniture, etc.)
  • Shipping of demo units
  • Agency fee for event management, co-branded Collateral, co-branded Invitations, co-branded registration Web site, co-branded giveaways
  • Gifts and entertainment (within Intel approved amounts)

For branding:
  • Image of venue set up
  • Image of product
  • Copy of presentation content
  • Image of any co-branding item submitted for reimbursement

1. Date/date range and location
2. Tax, discounts, rebates, bonus ads
3. Agency/Agent management fees
4. Total invoice amount
5. Itemization of Gift and Entertainment costs
6. Summary of venue costs
7. Attendee list

Yes, if:
1. sales are happening on-site at the event.
2. Invitation is non-transferable or unavailable to the public.

Submit as EVENT - Event.

If subject to spending limits, submit as EVENT - Event Limited Spend.

If including government attendees, submit as EVENT - Event (G)

If including government attendees AND subject to spending limits, submit as EVENT - Event Limited Spend (G)

4. Total invoice amount

6. Summary of set up costs
Yes
Submit as EVENT In-store Promoter - limited spend.
Marketing demonstration of products taking place outside a selling environment such as an airport, theatre, etc.

Balanced branding in the activity:
  • Intel logo on all venue decor (signage, including fact tags) and at least one Intel logo on the booth/kiosk if applicable
  • Mention of Intel when OEM system or solution is mentioned in the presentation or demonstration to end users
  • Inclusion of Intel content (available for download on the program Web site) in the material used to train promoters
Additionally Intel will reimburse the following items when co-branded:
  • Giveaways
  • Uniform for staff
  • Handout
Important: As per the general program requirement, Intel based systems must carry Intel on-system branding.
Not allowed

• Cost of hiring promoters
  • Promoters training cost (including venue)
  • Show participation fee
  • Event sponsorship fees
  • Participation fee paid by Member or third party for a third party's participation
  • Creative design for event signage and booth or kiosk
  • Logistics and venue related costs ( i.e. booth/venue set up; decoration; carpet, electrical, internet, furniture, etc.)
  • Shipping of demo units
  • Agency fee for event management , co-branded Collateral, co-branded Invitations, co-branded registration Web site, co-branded giveaways; Gifts and entertainment (within Intel approved amounts)

For branding:
  • Image of venue set up
  • Image of product showcase
  • Copy of presentation content
  • Image of any co-branding item submitted for reimbursement

1. Date/date range and location
2. Tax, discounts, rebates, bonus ads
3. Agency/Agent management fees
4. Total invoice amount
5. Itemization of Gift and Entertainment costs
6. Summary of Venue costs
Yes, if sales are happening on-site at the event.

Submit as EVENT - Event.

If subject to spending limits, submit as EVENT - Event Limited Spend.

A direct marketing model where salesperson solicits prospective customers to buy products or services, either over the phone or through a subsequent face to face appointment scheduled during the call.
Intel Mention required when Member system is mentioned.
Not allowed

• Telephone charges
  • Labor to deliver telemarketing
  • Copywriting, editing, translating, and formatting telemarketing scripts
  • Producing/printing scripts
  • Generating telemarketing performance metrics reports

• Venue cost to house the telemarketing team
  • Database rental or purchase
  • Development or maintenance of the reporting system
Telemarketing script

1. Date/date range and location

3. Agency/Agent management fees
4. Total invoice amount
5. Number of calls, creation cost (copy writing, editing, translating, and formatting
Yes
Submit as TELEMARKETING - Telemarketing - limited spend.

Advertisement created and placed in a third party print publication by Sales Partners or their agencies. Reimbursement is available for full pages or for parts of a page: Eligible Area applies For United States and Canada, this activity is eligible for Clip and Pay.

In the activity: Intel logo (standard size provided)

Ads created and placed by Sales Partner on their Web site. This category includes banner ads, text ads, contextual ads, mobile ads and video banners. Affiliate marketing is supported.
Cost-per-click (CPC) ads are supported on all Sales Partner web site pages
  • Cost-per-day (CPD) and cost-per-impression (CPM) ads are only supported on pages that visually feature eligible products. Exception: CPD/CPM ads are always allowed on home pages.
  • Member will be reimbursed for a maximum of two CPD/CPM ads on the same web page.

page_content.page:
The new Intel Inside® Program supports an extensive range of marketing activities. As you identify, create and execute your marketing activities, this interactive guide will provide you with specific reference tables summarizing the fundamental things to remember.

Things to Remember

  • The Intel Inside® Program supports activities targeting end users. An end user is defined as a person or organization that purchases products for their own use.
  • The branding framework applies for all activities
  • Requirements regarding other brand elements do not apply to landing pages
  • Some activities are subject to spending limits. Your budget for these activities will be displayed in your account summary. Check the View Spending Limit Funds page to make sure funds are available before performing such activities. Keep in mind that funds are shown as available until Reimbursement Requests are submitted.

The following are always excluded from Reimbursable Costs, regardless of who has paid them:

  • Cash Prizes
  • Taxes, agency or media company retainer fees and commissions
  • Member internal costs of any kind
  • Royalties or finance charges (cash prizes or your internal costs)

Joint Promotion

Marketing activities must promote a Member's Eligible Product, a Solution based an Eligible Product, or an Initiative.

[[image]]

Balanced Branding

Marketing activities must represent the Member's brand and Intel's brand in a balanced manner.

[[image]]

Other Brand Elements

Marketing activities may include other Brand Elements. Reimbursement percentage may vary based on their quantity, size, and use of a Top 20 brand.

[[image]]

Joint Promotion

Marketing activities must promote a Member's Eligible Product, a solution based an Eligible Product, or an initiative.

[[image]]

Solutions are defined as a combination of hardware software and/or services. Examples can be virtualization, cloud computing, etc.

Initiatives are defined as non-product focused activities positioning you and Intel as technology leaders. Examples can span from music to art to sport to scientific research.

The identifies Eligible Brands and their respective reimbursement rates.

Product Activites

Is your activity promoting a product? Make sure to use:

  • the appropriate Eligible processor logo - [[show the badges!]]
  • the appropriate Intel Mention for a processor (i.e. Intel® Core&tm; i5 processor) or a family (i.e. Intel® Core processors or Intel® Core family)

Alernative Intel Mentions for each processor brand will be available in the Brand Resource Center.

If the Intel Mention is not included in the headline, subhead or body copy of a marketing activity and is included in the specification list instead, it must be the first item on that list.

If an activity features multiple products, the Eligible Product(s) must occupy at least 50% of visual space or airtime.

[[image]]

For activities promoting Member product lines not entirely based on Intel processors, the exact sub-brand, model number, or SKU of the Intel-based product must be identified.

Solution or Initiative Activites

Is your activity promoting a solution or an initiative? (Note: if a product is mentioned either visually or in text, then Product Activity requirements apply.)

If no product is mentioned either visually or in text, then you may choose to use:

  • the Intel Masterbrand Mark
  • Intel® after your company name (this qualifies as the Intel Mention)

[[image]]

Shortened Intel Mentions

Shortened Intel Mentions are allowed in certain activities and vary according to the processor featured.

Guidance for Intel® Core&tm; Processors and Intel® Atom&tm; Processors

A shortened Intel Mention is available for use in online text ads only if the full Intel Mention appears on the ad's landing page. No other shortened use is allowed.

Guidance for Other Intel® Processors

A shortened Intel Mention is optional for use in print headlines, TV, radio, online banner and text ads. The full Intel Mention must appear on the ad's landing page. No other shortened use is allowed.

To create a shortened brand name, copy the approved Intel Mention from Brand Resource Center and remove the noun corresponding to the English word processor.

Balanced Branding

Marketing activities must represent the Member's brand and Intel's brand in a balanced manner.

For logos this means:

  • The area of your largest logo must be comparable to the area dedicated to the Intel logo. An online tool will be available for you to ensure this criteria is met.
  • If you choose to omit your logo from a marketing activity, Intel branding requirements still apply. A minimum size will be provided for each Intel logo.

For Intel Mentions this means:

  • Intel should be mentioned in the same font size as other body copy or at the same volume and speed as the rest of the audio
  • If an activity does not support graphics, a logo is not reauired, and only an Intel Mention is required
  • If an activity does not support text, an audio Intel Mention is required

Other Brand Elements

Marketing activities may include other Brand Elements. Reimbursement percentage may vary based on their quantity, size, and use of a Top 20 brand.

Inclusion of other brand elements is allowed but reimbursement may vary:

  • Inclusion of three or more non-Top 20 brands* will result in 25% reimbursement
  • Inclusion of one of a Top 20 brand will result in 25% reimbursement
  • Inclusion of more than one Top 20 brands will result in no reimbursement
  • Inclusion of the below brand elements won't impact reimbursement:
    • Other Intel processor brands
    • Intel-based products/technologies
    • Industry standard logos
    • Distribution channel logos
    • Payment method logos
    • Images of or from a movie or game (even if they belong to one of the Top 20 brands)
    • Up to two non-Top 20 global brands
*as defined by the INTERBRAND TOP GLOBAL BRAND CHART

All other brand elements should be smaller than the Intel logo, with the exception of:

  • Sales partner logos in sales partner activities
  • Logos of a third party organizer of an initiative (i.e. the Olympic Games)
  • Images of or from a movie or game (even if they belong to one of the Top 20 brands)

[[insert chart]]

Competition Inclusion

In many activities competition inclusion is allowed and will have an impact on reimbursement. Competition logo may not be larger than the Intel logo in the activity.

Specific details are provided on each activity type page.

Co-Branding Through Sales Partners

The Intel Inside Program offers you a wide range of activities to enable you go to market through your sales partners.

Sales Partners are third-party distribution channels that sell Member products to end users on behalf of the Member. Examples of Sales Partners include: retailers, e-tailers, telcos, resellers, and distributors. These activities are reimbursed according to rate cards created by an independent media auditor to reflect market prices. Rate cards will be phased in. If the activity runs in a location not covered by a rate card, standard documentation requirements apply (documentation must be provided by a third party).

[[rate cards phases image]]

The following conditions apply to sales partner activities:

  • Member must engage and agree upon the activity with the sales partner
  • Sales partner executes the activity
  • Member is respponsible to ensure that the activity meets Program requirements
  • Member is responsible for requesting reimbursement and for retaining documentation
  • Intel will only reimburse Members, not sales partners


The following conditions apply for advertisement on Sales Partner website:

  • Cost-per-click (CPC) ads are supported on all Sales Partner web site pages
  • Cost-per-day (CPD) and cost-per-impression (CPM) ads are only supported on pages that visually feature eligible products. Exception: CPD/CPM ads are always allowed on home pages.
  • Member will be reimbursed for a maximum of two CPD/CPM ads on the same web page.

    Clip and Pay (United States and Canada only)

    The Clip and Pay reimbursement model allows Members to be reimbursed without submitting reimbursement requests. This model is available only in the United States and Canada for Sales Partner flyers and catalogs distributed as inserts/outserts and for Sales Partner newspaper and magazine ads.

    Specific Branding Requirements

    To properly support sales partner activities we introduced two additional concepts:

    1. Sales partner logo may be larger than the Intel logo in the activity
    2. The following sales partner activities are reimbursed on eligible area. In this case a minimum size Intel logo is required:
      • Flyers & e-Flyers
      • Catalogs & e-Catalogs
      • Newspaper
      • Magazine
      • E-mail Marketing


    Eligible Area

    Certain sales partner activities feature multiple Member products on the same page. In order to support these activity types, the program allows reimbursement for parts of pages by defining an eligible area.

    Eligible Area is defined as the area within an advertisement, delineated by column rules, clear space and/or color, which contains only Member devices or solutions, proper supporting content, and Intel brand elements.

    On those activities reimbursed on eligible area, a reimbursement request may be submitted for a full page if the following requirements are met:

    1. Only one Member's products are featured on the page.
    2. The page does not feature any competitive products.
    3. If multiple products are featured, the eligible product must occupy at least 50% of the page, or all products featured are eligible products.

Events

The Intel Inside Program supports a variety of end user focused events. Events which target both end users and sales partners are supported, however events targeting sales partner only are not supported.

Gifts

Business gifts must not be offered with the intent of compromising the recipient's objectivity in making business decisions. Gifts must be valued at no more than $200 per person and Intel will reimburse up to 50%. Gifts include co-branded marketing merchandise and trinkets, Intel or other branded products, tangible non-cash items (e.i. watches), or any type of award.

Entertainment

Business entertainment must have a substantial business purpose. Entertainment must be valued at no more than $400 per person and Intel will reimburse up to 50%. Entertainment includes activities such as dining, concerts, sporting events, golf outings, travel and accommodations, etc. Entertainment does not include coffee breaks or lunch catering at an event venue.

Events With Government Attendees

Events with government attendees must be submitted in advance via the Create Activity page, where the Member will be required to comply with the provisions of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (http://www.fcpa.us). Government attendees include:

  • Government officials and SOE's (State Owned Enterprises) employees
  • All government employees, such as professors in public universities and employees of government owned research and development institutions

Member Web Sites

The Intel Inside Program supports co-branded online ads placed on your company's web site. These activities are reimbursed according to rate cards created by an independent media auditor to reflect market prices.

Specific requirements:

  • Cost-per-click (CPC) ads are supported on all Member web site pages
  • Cost-per-day (CPD) and cost-per-impression (CPM) ads are only supported on pages that visually feature eligible products. Exception: CPD/CPM ads are always allowed on home pages.
  • No more than two CPD/CPM ads are allowed on the same web page.

Print

Specific branding requirements for multi-page print

Front Cover

In order for a multi-page print activity to be eligible for reimbursement, the front cover must meet branding framework requirements for joint promotion, balanced branding, and other brand elements. Competition may not be included.

[[image]]
Internal Pages

Double spread pages can be treated as a single page. This means that if single page requirements are met, both pages will be reimbursed. For brochures, multiple spread pages can be treated as a single page. This means that if single page requirements are met, all eligible pages will be reimbursed.

[[image]]
